thread.title: This adorable kid wants to play tag, not wrestle
thread.title_full: This adorable kid wants to play tag, not wrestle

author: Andi Cwieka
title: This adorable kid wants to play tag, not wrestle
text:
Maybe track is in his future.
Most kids are pretty fearless when it comes to sports, whether they’re tumbling off balance beams or showing off their Steph Curry-like ball skills .
One little wrestler, however, wasn’t quite ready for his opponent.
Run away! Run away! (via @momthingx3) 
A post shared by espn (@espn) on Feb 28, 2017 at 10:21am PST 
Right after the handshake, as soon as the two start to square up, the kid takes off, making his opponent chase him around the mat.
Eventually she pins him down, but he squirms out and breaks free, setting off another running match. 
Warmed up and ready for running away! #raytothethird #boys #wrestling #wrestlingmom #wrestlingfamily #lifeisgood #love #rudis @the_rudis 
A post shared by Lexie Timbs (Salyers) (@momthingx3) on Feb 28, 2017 at 12:51pm PST 
Even though he didn’t win this round, he’ll definitely be one to watch – his dad is Nickolai Timbs, a former Ohio State wrestler. Timbs is currently the director of operations for Ohio State’s wrestling program, but also had a stint as a personal chef for elite athletes .
With a Division I wrestler in the family, this kid has got to be on the right path. Maybe running away is the next big wrestling strategy?
